conversations.content: Ready, Grimnir?
Indeed. Behold my power!
The wind! What's happening?!
The gales I summon split the sky and cleave the earth.
I am the mad cyclone. I am...GRIIIMNIIIR!
Waaaaugh!
You were a great help today, Grimnir. Thank you.
Heh. I merely served as a conduit for divine justice to see evildoers smote. It was nothing.
To the pure of heart, my wind is gentle as a summer breeze. To the wicked, it strikes with the weight of tempered steel.
And to you, brave soul, it shall be as wings fit to carry you to the empyrean and on!
Buddy, I am THIS close to taping your mouth shut if you don't use normal words.
Oh. Er, I was just saying, y'know, it was no big deal. Happy to help.
You ever think of just...sayin' that, then?
But I...I am compelled to weave a tapestry of prose that echoes the solemn howling of my soul!
...I'll fetch the tape, then.
Gah! I mean I want it to sound cool, okay?!
Don't force it, buddy.
I'm not forcing anything!!! This is the product of years of diligent training!
And yet you could have put your efforts towards something far more practical.
Waaaaaaah! At least YOU get me, right, Prince? Tell me you're on my side here!
Aha ha...ha...
What's with the awkward laugh?!
I don't mean to offend. There are simply times when, as the others say, I'm not certain what you're saying.
But you needn't change on anyone else's account.
If you want to...weave a tapestry, was it? With your soul howling? Well, I support you all the way.
Oh, bless you, magnanimous Prince.
That's Euden for you.
It's extremely Euden.
Heh. The covenant of our fellowship is sworn here and now! Let my wind ever blow at your back!
Dude. Tape.
Let's be friends! ...Please.
We already are, Grimnir. We already are.
Come to think of it, Grimnir's been with us for a while now. Is he settling in all right?
He seems to be getting on well enough.
What she said. Oh, and Aldred swung by the castle a little while ago and...
My left arm throbs... Damn you, Syndicate monsters.
Do my ears deceive me? Dare I believe?!
Have I found the bearer of a kindred soul?!
My right arm throbs... The souls of two score hundred demons sealed within it seethe.
What are you supposed to be? Leave my sight, before this accursed wyrmbinding in my left arm rages beyond my control!
Heh, then we two share the same burden. I am the war-god, Grimnir. Let us swear a forbidden oath, here and now!
What are you—*gasp* No! Are you with the Syndicate?!
Start talking! You'll tell me all you know, or the abomination I harbor within will drag it out of you!
WYRMBINDING! Feel the brunt of my accursed power—ngah?! Can't...control!
Arm...throbbing!
Yes...YES! I TOTALLY get that! Arms are the WORST!
Two abyssal souls, brought together now by fate, resonate and echo forth!
Hnnngh... THROBBING!!!
It looked like they were getting along great!
You sure about that?
Yeesh... Speaking of Grimnir, he had a run-in with Malora the other day.
Ooh, what have we here? A fresh recruit?
I am the war-god, heaven sent. My name...is Grimnir.
I have alighted upon fair Alberia tasked with nothing less than saving the world from destruction.
Awww. Aren't you adorable?
You would dare cross the threshold of, uh...
Mmm? Of what, sweetie?
Personal space! You're very close, Miss!
Ah ha ha! Look at you blushing. Still new to all this? That only makes you cuter.
I know a guy who insists on getting close, but this feels more threatening!
Waaaaah! Priiince, heeeeelp!
...Saddest thing I ever saw.
Good to see him getting...friendly? With the others? If we can call it that.
At the very least, he's begun to settle in.
I suppose that's progress.
Is it, though? Ah, well. It's no skin off my wings. ♪ ...Ew, phrasing, Notte.
Hey, have you seen Grimnir?
I think he's on watch duty out east today. Why?
Aw, he's working? I was gonna ask to play with him again.
You've played with Grimnir?
Yeah! He uses his wind to float you up in the air.
It's awesome! You should come try it too, Euden!
That does sound like fun. Unfortunately, it will have to wait for another time when he isn't on duty.
Nah. I got this one, you guys. I'll go swap shifts with him.
You really don't mind?
The new kid's makin' friends. How's a guy NOT gonna encourage that?
Hee hee, thank you! You're the best, Ranzal. Now, c'mon! Let's all go together!
Lead on.
Aha ha ha! This is great!
I feel like a faerie!
Hey, now. Don't go wiggling around too much up there. I don't want you falling!
Okaaay!
Heh. He doesn't come across as the most reliable fellow, but he's comfortable in the big-brother role around the little ones.
Yes. I'm relieved to see him so at home here.
Right...
Do you not agree, Cleo?
No, it is as you say—he does seem to have settled in. But...just between us...
He's such a curious case. Take that wind.
What about it?
Mind you, I have no proof of what I'm about to venture. Honestly, I'm not even certain it's possible...
But his mana suggests that he may not be human at all. And mana doesn't lie.
He certainly looks the part, so I'd never thought to question it.
What do you suspect he might be, if not human?
I couldn't say. He's clearly not a sylvan, nor a rokkan or qilin.
I sense from him a mana I've never felt before.
Something...vast. In the realm of the gods he claims to walk among.
The war-god, Grimnir... Just who is he, really?
Pipple!
Mwah ha ha! Stop your running, my good Pipple!
Pi! PIIIIII!
Hm? GWAAAUGH?!
Oh gosh, oh jeez! I've got a relic on the rampage here! It's gone berserk!
Is everybody okay?!
So much for the weapon I was commissioned to make...
We've got to dry it off, quickly! Here, we'll help you.
Plants and humans and...
She's gotta be a qilin, right? And a rokkan...
Er, Grimnir? What are you mumbling about there?
Sylvan!
Indeed I am. May I ask why you're shouting that fact at me?
Oh, sorry. Just noting that this castle really is home to all kinds of people.
True. We've gathered across the borders of race or nationality because we share a set of ideals. Now we work to realize them.
I believe they were all drawn here by Euden's welcoming and open-minded nature.
Wouldn't you say, Euden?
Sorry, what? What are we talking about?
Just that the reason we're all able to live here so happily is thanks to your efforts, Euden.
Oh, goodness. I haven't done anything special.
You say that, but I don't think there'd be anywhere near this many different folks running around the Halidom if you weren't the boss.
I would certainly second that.
I don't know about that... Well, whatever the reason, so long as everyone's happy, I'm happy, too.
So, how did we come to talk about this?
Oh, Grimnir seemed to be struck by the diversity of the Halidom's residents.
Did you have some question or concern about that, Grimnir?
When divergent forms and faiths collide, it oft beckons a maelstrom at best. At worst, it portends a singularity of fates.
Still no idea what you're talking about.
Ugh. I'm saying it can be tricky when lots of different people come together.
What of you yourself, Grimnir?
Huh?
Your mana makes it clear you are not human.
Just what are you, then?
What am I? Well, if you would know...
I am the wind that blows through time. The Tuner who imposes order upon a world in chaos. I am the mad cyclone, Griiim—
We can skip this part.
Wha—hey! Nooo, I was just getting to the best bit!
I'm starting to think we don't know who you are precisely because you always dodge the question with your abstruse bloviation.
Yeah, all your abstruse bloviation! ...Remind me what that means again?
Er, something abstruse is inaccessible and difficult to understand. And to bloviate is to speak a lot yet say very little, I believe?
To say very—HEY! That's not fair at all! I work really hard to think these lines up!
Then tell us, plainly. I struggle to think that you're secretly a villain, but I cannot trust someone I know nothing about.
You can't say?
I'm sorry. But know that I am not your enemy. I hope you can trust in that, at least.
...All right. I trust you.
Are you sure that's wise? That means granting free run of the Halidom to an unknown entity.
He must have circumstances he's not at liberty to share. In the time I've known him, Grimnir has proven trustworthy.
Who or whatever he is, I believe that is reason enough to grant him a place here. Do you object?
Prince...
*sigh* I don't know what to do with you sometimes... And yet, I'm not surprised in the slightest by your verdict.
If the castle's master welcomes him, he's as much a part of the Halidom as I am.
Thank you, Cleo.
I should think I've said nothing to merit thanks.
Let me thank you as well, Prince. It was an inevitability of fate that we should meet. For ours is a destined alliance.
Know that my winds shall never pierce the flesh of my allies. I swear before you now that they shall be ever as your shield!
Cool story, bro. Whatever you say.
I...feel like you guys' reactions are getting weaker over time here.
(The prince is kind of heart and commands the trust of all who dwell here. I cannot imagine he would disrupt fate's flow...)
(But the keeper told me that he was an irregularity who had no equal counterpart in any of the other timelines.)
(Just what does that mean for this world? For all worlds, across all realities?)
(Even fate's keeper held no answer to that question.)
Determining that is my task as Tuner.
It's weird, right?
Definitely. Think something happened?
I sense great disquiet here. What trouble ails you, friends?
Euden's squad still isn't back yet.
We got a tip that the Empire'd attacked a nearby village, so he headed out with a team to deal with it.
But that was three days ago. It's been too long. Somethin' ain't right.
Then...
*gasp...* *wheeze!*
Ezelith! You were part of the team that was with Euden, right?
If YOU got thrashed, somethin' bad is afoot. Are the others who went with you okay? What happened?!
We played right into their hands.
What?!
The villagers were in on it. The Empire knew that if they spread word a village was under attack, we'd come running.
They used Euden's kindness against him!
It was an ambush. There were so many of them. They had us cornered...
Euden told me to come and get help. I barely made it out alive...
But the others... They're still... Euden's still in danger!
Please. You have to...go and save him, you...big lunk...
We will. Don't you worry about a thing. We'll take it from here. You rest easy.
You did good, kid.
The rest is...in your hands...
You heard the gal! We gotta hurry!
Right. Grimnir, you come with—
...Huh? Where'd he go?
(So the time has come.)
Ngh... *huff*
Cleo! Are you all right?!
Yes... Somehow...
(This isn't good. They've split us in half, and everyone is exhausted, besides. At this rate, we won't—)
Aaaaaugh?!
CLEO!
Don't move! Don't nobody move!
If you do, I can't make any promises about what happens to the girl.
Rgh... Why? Why are you...helping them?
You really gotta ask? We just have to hand you over, and they'll make sure we never go without again.
I'm never letting one bad harvest mean we have to pick who lives and dies again!
Yeah!
Please, listen to me... Whatever they told you, I can promise you that they'll never give you the future you desire.
Shut yer mouth, you!
What you're doing is useless. There is too large a gap between your power and his.
Even in numbers, even if you take hostages, you have no hope of taking Euden captive.
Nrgh! Well... Well, then we'll at least make an offering of your head!
NO, DON'T!
(Cleo! Dammit, there's no way to save her without killing the villagers!)
Nnngaaaah!
Rrgh! Do I really have no choice?!
HRAAAAAH!
Gwargh?!
Foolish, pitiable denizens of this land... Your petty machinations are undone before me, as the dew fades in morning's sun.
Who the hell are YOU?!
If you would ask my identity, I shall oblige! For I am the mad cyclone, protector of fate and friend alike—Grimnir, war-god!
Grimnir! You're a welcome sight! Are you unharmed, Cleo?!
I am fine. You have my thanks, Grimnir!
Er, Grimnir? Everything all right?
...d it.
Hm?
...NAILED IT! That was absolutely bang-on that time! MAN, I am awesome!
Oh, er... *AHEM* Now, downtrodden masses. Lay down your arms, or face the war-god's judgment!
What's WITH this guy?! Rrgh, I'm not about to surrender to some washed-up theater kid!
Heh. Pitiable indeed. Then taste the wind of my whirlwin...wait, that's two winds. Uhhh... UHHH...! HAVE AT YOU!
You truly saved us today, Grimnir. Had you not come to our aid, I fear that—
You might've killed them?
...Yes. I fear I'd steeled my heart to do just that.
I don't doubt it. In order to save his fellow, the seventh scion of Alberia did strike down the villagers.
Though betrayed by those he was tasked to protect and left no other choice, their end cast an indelible shadow upon his soul...
Is that...a premonition of my future self?
In another timeline, perhaps. But that is not the future that awaits you, Prince.
Yet perhaps, as a steward of causality, it was not my place to intervene today.
Do you regret it, then? That your actions today changed the course of history?
It's nothing you need concern yourself with. Each branch of time affects the rest.
The pain you were spared today will return to find you in some other way, upon some other day.
My actions here held little meaning, in the end.
Then...why did you save me?
Well, I... That's...
Because we're friends, I guess?
Euden.
Hm? Oh, Grimnir. What has you up at this late hour?
I could ask you the same, my sworn companion.
It seems I find you lost in thought as deep as the abyssal dark of this starless night.
And so I have come to dispel the shadow that envelops your heart...ah, ahem...
Look, if you wanna talk about it, I'm here. To listen, I mean! If you want. No presh.
I just thought, I dunno, maybe you'll feel better if you get it off your chest.
You're very kind, Grimnir. But I fear this is a problem I must grapple with myself.
Aw, don't say that. I'm more helpful than I look, you know. I've seen...a lot. Like, a LOT a lot.
It hasn't been easy for you either, has it? You...said you were a Tuner, sent here by a ＂keeper of fates.＂
I've been trying to sort through your remarks. To understand them, the best I'm able.
Your duty is to stop those who would alter the past or future, or to punish those who already have. Is that correct?
Forgive me, my friend. I cannot speak to the details of my employment, for I am duty-bound to silence.
But, um... Don't take that personally. It's just how it is, man. What can you do, am I right?
Well, whatever the specifics, I understand you're unable to say much. But at least tell me what you can.
If I'm not off in my assumptions, you're here to monitor me. Am I getting warm?
Huh?
I may one day become someone who disrupts the natural timeline you describe. And you're here to keep watch over that.
And that's assuming you don't already know the future that awaits me.
Perhaps your true role here is to kill me once I become a threat to the timeline. Or before, even.
Whoa, hey, nobody said anything about killing here! I just—
No. It's fine, Grimnir. If anything, I would almost take comfort in it.
Euden...
At times, I lose sight of who or what I am. It...scares me, to be frank.
I'm resolved to keep going just the same. I won't stray from the path I believe is just. Too many have joined my cause to stop.
But still, uncertainty takes hold of me in my weakest moments. Of where this path I've chosen will lead.
If I am marching us all towards tragedy, or something still worse...
Grimnir, if or when that happens... Please, I want you to k—
Pfft... Heh heh. Ha ha ha ha ha!
Er, is something funny?
So that's the kind of red-hot third act twist you're hoping for, Prince?
So be it, then. Now, normally I'D be the one looking to play martyr, but since you asked first, I'll just be your understudy.
Unsurprisingly, you've lost me yet again.
Don't you worry. I hear you loud and clear. The prince, fallen prey to his own darkest fears... The war-god, his merciful liberator!
GAH, that's gonna be SWEET! Talk about a climax!
I... What? Truly, fundamentally: what?
Look. Lemme clue you in on something here, Euden.
It's true that among the myriad worlds, there are some that hold clues to what this world's future will come to be.
And yes, among them there is a world where a certain seventh Alberian prince marches on toward unspeakable tragedy.
Then it is as I feared...
But the future's not something so easily pinned down.
One timeline resonates with another, so it's true that any given world is likely to proceed to a future hinted at in another.
But if everything was predetermined, guys like me would be out of a job.
The fact that I'm even here at all is a testament to the possibilities before you. Right?
Because if my every move from here on were set in stone, there would be no need to monitor me...
I suppose that makes sense. And if the future ISN'T set, then it's in our power to guide and shape it to some extent.
Thank you, Grimnir. That has indeed eased my mind a bit.
You needn't thank me, bosom friend. For not even the muddy mire of self-doubt can dim the diamantine shine of our bond.
Er, I'm not certain I catch your meaning, but...I'm glad to hear it.
Wait, really? I thought it was a pretty solid line. Was it not cool?
The line may have been wasted on me, Grimnir, but your earnest efforts to cheer me up were very cool indeed.
Uhhh... Gosh! Um, okay. Great, then!
I hope I can continue to count on you being my stalwart ally long into the future, indecipherable monologuing and all.
Heh. But of course, my friend. My wind will ever be your feal wings, to guide you to the heavens and beyond... EXCELSIOR!
Excelsior, Grimnir. And thank you.
My pleasure, buddy!
